items.title: Jaguar Land Rover says data stolen in disruptive cyberattack
items.summary: The cyberattack at Jaguar Land Rover, which began on September 2, has ground vehicle assembly lines to a standstill.

items.title: Bending Spoons agrees to acquire video platform Vimeo in an all-cash deal valued at ~$1.38B, set to close in Q4; Vimeo will be delisted from exchanges (Lynn Doan/Bloomberg)
items.summary:
Lynn Doan / Bloomberg:
Bending Spoons agrees to acquire video platform Vimeo in an all-cash deal valued at ~$1.38B, set to close in Q4; Vimeo will be delisted from exchanges  —  Bending Spoons, one of Europe's largest mobile app developers, has agreed to buy the video platform Vimeo in an all-cash deal valued at about $1.38 billion.

items.title: Sources: Amazon is developing consumer AR glasses codenamed Jayhawk with microphones, speakers, a camera, and color display, set for late 2026 or early 2027 (The Information)
items.summary:
The Information:
Sources: Amazon is developing consumer AR glasses codenamed Jayhawk with microphones, speakers, a camera, and color display, set for late 2026 or early 2027  —  Amazon is developing a pair of augmented-reality glasses for consumers, say two people with knowledge of the plans.

items.title: Sony launches giant fall PlayStation sale with over 3,400 titles at up to 75% off
items.summary:
While Nintendo did just officially confirm its long-rumored and highly-anticipated September Direct showcase for this week, today we are taking a look at the PlayStation side of things. Sony has now unleashed the latest major event on the PlayStation Store with the new Autumn Adventures sale featuring deals on over 3,400 titles and DLC expansions at up to 75% off. From MLB The Show 25 and Split Fiction to College Football 26, Call of Duty titles, and the ongoing price drop on Assassin’s Creed Shadows at 33% off, now’s a great time to shore up your catalog ahead of the big holiday releases – the sale will run from today through September 24. 

more…

items.title: Reddit, Yahoo, Medium, Quora, People, O'Reilly, wikiHow, Ziff Davis, and others adopt the Really Simple Licensing (RSL) Standard to set terms for AI scraping (Emma Roth/The Verge)
items.summary:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
Reddit, Yahoo, Medium, Quora, People, O'Reilly, wikiHow, Ziff Davis, and others adopt the Really Simple Licensing (RSL) Standard to set terms for AI scraping  —  Reddit, Yahoo, Quora, and wikiHow are just some of the major brands on board with the RSL Standard.

items.title: RSS co-creator launches new protocol for AI data licensing
items.summary: A new system called Real Simple Licensing would allow AI companies to license training data at a massive scale — if they're willing to pay for it.

items.title: AI gaming startup Born raises $15M to build ‘social’ AI companions that combat loneliness
items.summary: Born, maker of cute virtual pet Pengu, believes the current chatbot landscape isn't the final form factor for AI friends. The Berlin-based startup raised $15M on the idea that AI companions should have a social component.

items.summary: Clyx is social platform that helps users find IRL community events to join.

items.title: Grammarly now offers spelling and grammar check for five more languages
items.summary: Grammarly built its reputation on being a tool for checking spelling, grammar, and writing tips in English. The company is now expanding the scope of these features to support five new languages: Spanish, French, Portuguese, German and Italian.

items.title: Zoox’s robotaxis are open for business in Las Vegas
items.summary: Amazon’s Zoox announced today that it’s making its robotaxis available to all customers in Las Vegas. The company says it is the first to operate with a purpose-built autonomous vehicle in commercial service. And the news comes a few weeks after federal regulators gave the company the green light to expand the use of its […]

items.title: The web has a new system for making AI companies pay up
items.summary: A new licensing standard aims to let web publishers set the terms of how AI system developers use their work. On Wednesday, major brands like Reddit, Yahoo, Medium, Quora, and People Inc. announced support for Really Simple Licensing (RSL), an open content licensing standard that enables publishers to outline how bots should pay to scrape […]

items.title: Grammarly can now fix your Spanish and French grammar
items.summary: For 16 years, a team of linguists carefully crafted and honed the grammar editing software Grammarly to match natural English language patterns. Now, the company is getting a big assist from AI to expand similar offerings to five more languages: Spanish, French, Portuguese, German, and Italian. This expansion caters to what has been the “number […]

At the same time, it's also adding thousands more titles to the bring-your-own-games service by letting you install them yourself, […]

Reddit removes visible subscriber counts from subreddit pages, replacing it with seven-day active visitors or contributions, to better reflect user activity  —  ﻿Users will now see seven-day metrics that track active visitors and contributions instead.

items.summary:
Much like we featured this morning on the new Apple Watch Series 11, pre-orders are now live on the new AirPods Pro 3. If you have some free store credit at Amazon, you might want to grab them there, and Best Buy has some deals to consider as well. As of right now, it does not look like Apple is accepting trades towards its new pro-grade AirPods, but Best Buy is delivering a FREE $20 store credit for members on top of some trade-in value for your previous set.

items.title: Cherry’s regularly $179 wireless mechanical gaming keyboard with RGB just plunged to $50 (72% off)
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find Cherry’s official storefront offering its MX 8.2 TKL Wireless Mechanical Gaming Keyboard in black for $49.99 shipped. This particular model with the brand’s MX2A switches debuted around the same time last year, and has mostly been fetching its full $179 price. Today’s deal, however, delivers a whopping 72% discount on it, shaving $129 off its usual going rate. It dropped to the $100 mark a couple of times this year, but today’s deal steps things up with an additional $50 off, marking a new best price to beat. The white variant of this keyboard is also seeing a discount, albeit a relatively lighter one at $69.99 shipped. Head below for more details.

Apple’s new AirPods Pro 3 have arrived and are now up for pre-order with a series of new features, better ANC, heart-rate monitoring, and more. But the AirPods Pro 2 were the world’s most popular wireless buds for a reason and if you’re not looking to drop the full $249 on the new series 3 set, Woot is offering a notable factory refurbished deal on AirPods Pro 2 down at $99.99 Prime shipped using code EARBUDS20 at checkout with a full Amazon warranty.

items.title: Up to 50% off launch deals on ESR’s iPhone 17 cases now live: MagSafe-compatible models with Camera Control from just $10
items.summary:
Apple’s iPhone 17 lineup is now official, and it arrives with a wave of new cases and accessories. We’ve already looked at options from brands like Spigen and Nomad, and now ESR is joining the mix with its iPhone 17 case collection – currently available with launch discounts of up to 50% off. ESR has new cases for the entire iPhone 17 lineup, including the standard iPhone 17, Air, and the Pro models, and they’re starting at just $9.99 Prime shipped right now. All these models are MagSafe-compatible and have a dedicated Camera Control button, and they’re all available in a bunch of different finishes. Head below for a closer look and more details.

items.title: AirPods Pro 3 and Apple Watch Series 11/Ultra 3 pre-orders now live at Amazon
items.summary:
Apple has now officially unleashed its next-generation iPhone 17 lineup, Apple Watch Series 11, Apple Watch SE3, Apple Watch Ultra 3, and the new AirPods Pro 3. All of this joins a host of new accessories and is now up for pre-order (iPhone 17 pre-sales go live on Friday though). While you can of course pre-order all of the new gear straight from Apple, it is also all now live on Amazon, and if you have some FREE store credit on your account from all of the promotional offers we have featured over the last several months – there were hundreds in Amazon credit promotions live for Prime Day this year – you can now leverage it on the new Apple gear.

At Amazon, you can currently find the EGO Power+ Nexus Portable Power Station with two 7.5Ah batteries at $899 shipped. This bundled package usually runs for $1,099 without discounts, which we’ve mostly seen keeping down near $999 with discounts. While these drops to $899 are usually rare sightings, the price has been holding out strong since mid-August, with no telling how much longer it may last. Aside from the $838 low we saw once back during Black Friday, you’re otherwise looking at the best tracked price, which saves you $200 off the going rate. If you already have a collection of EGO ARC batteries, you can pick the station up on its own for $593.
